intro: Pleuroplitis langsdorffii var. breviseta, commonly known as the short-hairy pleuroplitis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and narrow, while the flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in clusters. This variant is distinguished by its shorter, more densely hairy stems compared to the typical form.
